name: Four Seasons Resort Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Four Seasons late evening following the 'loss ' of all of our baggage by British Airways at Gatwick. We had booked the hotel's 'meet & assist service 'and the staff member was outstanding in trying to resolve the baggage issue. When it was clear that BA did not have a clue ( and cared less) about the luggage, unknown to us, he contacted the hotel and upon arrival in our room we found a change of clothes and additional toiletries to enable us to settle in - whats more at no charge! Finally,3 days later when BA refused to hand over the luggage to anyone except me, the hotel provided a limo to and from the airport with full staff support to negotiate it thru'customs etc. I cannot recommend this service enough - you are met 'airside', all documentation is taking care of and you just walk thru' the queues to the car!
reviews.title: Fabulous Four Seasons
Fabulous Hotel a real 5 star experience
reviews.text: We stayed for 10 days and the food and service were of the highest standard ( save the last night when the team lacked leadership- consequently, waiting times and service quality dropped off. At these prices this just should not happen but experience shows me this can occur anywhere in the world in quality hotels!) There are three main restaurants ( the fouth being refitted during our visit) and dinner will set you back between £70 - £100+ for two. This can include wine if you are careful in your choice ,otherwise it just gets very silly due to taxes. The Egyptian Sharandze and South African white are fine. If you are more discerning then expect to pay £70+ -,Lanson Black Label bubbly is £225 a bottle!!!!

We also ate at the Hyatt Hotel Thai restaurant , again about £80 for two but very. very good. Again we used the hotel limo (BMW Series 5 / 7) to get there and about and although a little pricey, the Four Seasons quaility and reliability shone through. The rooms are very spacious (we stayed in the deluxe) with high quality furnishings throughout and the beds are very comfortable ( made by Sealy especially for Four Seasons chain) with bedding being changed every day. Bathrooms are a delight and everything is kept clean to the highest standard.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the Four Seasons

reviews.text: I was surprised to find no DVD or decent CD in the room despite the hotel's web site stating they were fitted to every room. The TV provides SKY, BBC World etc should you need to keep up with the news. Room Service is good with a quick response time as is the laundry with reasonable charges.
reviews.title: Incredible experience at the Four Seasons
Absolutely Fabulous!
reviews.text: The Spa & Wellness Centre services are very good, not the best we have had as there are no decent views,and charge around £100 - 120 for a massage

There is very little I can say about this resort other than to tell you it is the best resort hotel we have ever stayed in and we have been to the very best that the world has to offer. I was completely taken aback that a hotel in this very 'touristy' part of the world could offer a sophistication and a standard which you would normally only find in the great cities. The new general manager, Jean Claude Wietzel, was formerly deputy manger at the wonderful Four Seasons George V in Paris and has only been in post for 5 months but he already has plans for making this wonderful resort even more special. I do not envy him his job as I would find it a real challenge to make this any better than it is.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reasons I found this resort so perfect were almost too many to list. We stayed for 7 nights over Xmas 2007 in a Premier Room with beautiful sea views and a lovely balcony. The temperature was delightful for this time of year - 24-28 degrees from 08.00 until around 16.30 when the temperature dropped to around 13-15 degrees. The sea temperature was always between 22-24 degrees and very pleasant - but remember - I am from Scotland where the temperature was minus 11 degrees on the day I left and the luggage trolleys at the airport were frozen together when I checked in for the flight!
reviews.title: Unparalleled Service - Faultless!

likes.disliked: — The walkway tiles were raised and as such this makes it unsuitable for disabled travellers or those not steady on their feet.

reviews.text: The 6 hour flight from Edinburgh was direct with FlyGlobespan and was effortless. There is only 2 hours time difference so no jet lag problems. There were no biting or stinging insects on the resort and the water in the hotel is processed by reverse osmosis so is safe to drink. The whole resort is impeccably clean, neat and tidy. The security, which I must admit was an issue for me prior to my departure was just the right balance to make for perfect peace of mind without being obtrusive. I was totally reassured and would have no hesitation in returning.
reviews.title: first class four seasons

reviews.text: The staff were just outstanding - every single one of them. The service was faultless throughout the entire resort.
reviews.title: Returned for 2nd year - still fantastic
The Best Place to Stay
reviews.text: The food is good with a wide selection and many dining options. Many people have commented on it being expensive. This is one of the leading resort hotels in the entire world - what do you expect? The wine is not great but this is a Muslim country where the government has a duty to observe the prevailing religious teachings which forbids the consumption of alcohol. For this reason they tax it 300%. If you are going on holiday to drink good wine, then this is not the place for you. We are wine lovers but decided not to have any during our stay as it was not appropriate. This did not spoil our experience in any way.
Stayed 7 times in Sharm and always in 5 stars hotel but 4Seasons is the best one. You will get better stay if you choose not standard room. Really 5 star deluxe hotel.
reviews.title: Stayed 7 times in Sharm but 4Seasons is the best one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you get to a stage where you just feel like being looked after look no further than the four seasons.
reviews.title: You deserve the best, go on treat yourself

likes.liked: — Nothing was too much for the staff. Your enjoyment was paramount to them
likes.disliked: — It is pretty expensive! But you do get what you pay for

reviews.text: If you are looking for somewhere plush, then there apparantly is no comparison.
reviews.title: The Perfect Resort

likes.disliked: — A little expensive, but I guess that helps maintaint he standard of the clientele.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem is that when you examine 5* hotels in Sharm with reference to price there will be a phenominal difference between the four seasons and the next best the hyatt (probably twice the price) BUT IT WILL BE WELL WORTH IT - i promise.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally stayed at the Sonesta beach as we wanted to stay in Naama bay, but unfortunately whilst advertised as a 5* it is more realistically a 3* at best and i get the impression that the majority of hotels are the same. We ended up leaving after 5 days as we really weren't enjoying our break.
reviews.title: out of this world!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, guys... this IS The Four Seasons.. What else do you expect than excellent service and lots of zeros on your bill upon departure? :) (and to be honest, if you can afford it, don't tell me its expensive, you chose it and you know very well why you did it)
reviews.title: The same old FourSeasons

reviews.text: Personally what I loved the most was the fantastic breakfast with all that superb food, freshly baked Egyptian bread, freshly sliced fruits for your salad and that huge smile on the peoples faces.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel ?

likes.disliked: — Too expensive to live there permanently!

reviews.text: The guy polishing your sunglasses and offering Evian spritz and the little cable car in the garden to get down to the beach is obviously the usual Four Seasons 'lets overdo things a bit' feeling, however the car can help disabled people (and lazy Americans - sorry guys, thats the truth:P ) to get easily down through the huge gardens to the beach (which is not small, dont forget: you have to use the jetty to get to the water because of the coral reef, so does not make a difference if its small or not, there are plenty of sunbeds on different levels close to the jetty).
reviews.title: Excellent, Fantastic, Superb, Stunning !!!!

likes.liked: — It's original layout, it was as if we each had our private apartment, no corridors or noise from other rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favorite restaurant was the one at the lower pool, and for the evening the open-air shisha bar with the white shades and chillout-music was just perfect!
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family suite was really amazing, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, washing machine and dryer, living room, kitchenette, 3 terracces all for 2 people only! wooooooooooow :))))
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in

likes.liked: — Total luxury, superb service, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — The town of Sharm el Sheikh is a dump!

description: Rare among international sun destinations: a desert-and-sea hideaway - combining the Sinai Desert's guaranteed year-round sunshine and sand-swept landscapes with the Red Sea's turquoise waves and world-class diving. Four Seasons welcomes guests to Sharm El Sheikh's most complete resort: an oasis of lush greenery, swimming and spa, where authentic Egyptian traditions come to life with thoughtfully personalised care.
